intro: Chelonanthus fistulosus, commonly known as the slenderpipe gourd, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant produces cylindrical, green fruits that are typically harvested when immature. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. The flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant.
